b2bpl
Class Project

java.lang.Object
  b2bpl.Project

public class Project
extends java.lang.Object

Simple datastructure containing the settings of the project to translate. A Project contains the information about the bytecode classes to translate as well as other user configurations such as the set of transformations to apply to the resulting BoogiePL program and other settings which, to some extent, determine the behavior of the compiler. A convenience method is provided for creating an adequately configured Project based on a set of supported command line arguments.

Author:
Ovidio Mallo
See Also:
Main, SpecificationProvider, BPLTransformator

Field Detail

projectTypes

private java.lang.String[] projectTypes
The names of the classes to verify. Defaults to the empty set.

See Also:
getProjectTypes()

specificationProvider

private SpecificationProvider specificationProvider
The optional SpecificationProvider to be used for the project. Defaults to a minimal DefaultSpecificationProvider.

See Also:
getSpecificationProvider()

specificationDesugarer

private SpecificationDesugarer specificationDesugarer
The SpecificationDesugarer to be used for BML specifications. Defaults to a StandardDesugarer.

See Also:
getSpecificationDesugarer()

transformators

private BPLTransformator[] transformators
The set of transformators to apply to the BoogiePL program generated during the translation. Defaults to the empty set.

See Also:
getTransformators()

outFile

private java.lang.String outFile
The file to which to output the BoogiePL program generated during the translation in case all the bytecode classes are translated into a single BoogiePL program. Defaults to the string "-" which represents the standard output.

See Also:
translateSeparately, getOutFile()

translateSeparately

private boolean translateSeparately
Whether to translate every bytecode class to a separate BoogiePL program in a separate file. Defaults to false. If this flag is turned on, the BoogiePL program belonging to a specific bytecode class will be output to a separate file whose name is the class' name followed by the file ending ".bpl" and the outfile eventually set on the project will be ignored.

See Also:
isTranslateSeparately()

thisInvariantsOnly

private boolean thisInvariantsOnly
Whether the BoogiePL program generated should only check whether the object invariants of the this object have been violated instead of verifying the invariants of all instances of the method's receiver type.

See Also:
isThisInvariantsOnly()

modelRuntimeExceptions

private boolean modelRuntimeExceptions
Whether to explicitly model the control flow in bytecode methods originating from the runtime exceptions thrown by individual bytecode instructions. Defaults to false, meaning that runtime exceptions are, by default, not modeled in the control flow graph and ruled out by appropriate verification conditions during the program verification.

See Also:
isModelRuntimeExceptions()

maxIntConstant

private int maxIntConstant
The maximal magnitude of constants to represent explicitly in the BoogiePL program generated by the translation. This avoids the theorem prover having to deal with very large constants which may have a negative impact on the performance of the verification. Defaults to 100000.

See Also:
getMaxIntConstant()

Method Detail

fromCommandLine

public static Project fromCommandLine(java.lang.String[] args,
                                      java.io.PrintWriter messageWriter)
Creates a new project which is configured according to the set of command line arguments (args) provided.

Parameters:
args - The set of command line arguments which will determine the configuration of the new project.
messageWriter - A writer to which help messages about the supported command line arguments or possible errors occurred while parsing the command line arguments are delegated.
Returns:
The new, configured project, or null if some error occurred while parsing the command line arguments or if only the help message was requested.
